comment.body: I agree, I don't really have any use for it sadly :-( But I hope to see zites using it pop up soon!

Welcome! How are you liking it so far?
@Archivofox: Too true. I wish there was more going on hereabouts.
Do you mean ZeroUp? I don't know ZeroHub.
You should follow me ;-)
Welcome!

Welcome to ZeroNet! Happy to see some more interest in P2P networks from others in the hentai community, it's a very thin silver lining to the fall of Sadpanda.

I'm running two hentai manga focused ZeroGallery hubs: [Alotaplot](/1G8VWDQc5fXLkRiijJB4EZerDLmDVY75MZ/) and Anthology.jp, totalling ~450GB (i.e. nothing), and I'm adding more every week. Short term there is absolutely no way to do this for the Sadpanda's archives due to their size, but I think that would be ideal in the long run. I also run a [/h/entai](/19WTvkdL8rUnAqZNtg3XaPTiDsCAcc22eB/) board at Millchan Engine.

@SadLoli: IPFS is really interesting, I hope blurhy's IPZN or something like it takes off so we can use both together efficiently.
> How do you reckon 1+Gallery would perform with ~50TB of shared data?
Hard to say. The viewer is dealing well with 5000 galleries. The hub manager *was* getting slow with 2000, but @1pgallery updated it recently and it's doing great now for my use case. I'd bet it can handle 10x what I'm doing now (if it's linear), but that'd still only be 4TB. I think it's also more to do with the number of files than the size of them.

The upside of a hub system is that you could always split the collection over multiple hubs so it doesn't matter that much whether the hubs can handle 1TB or 100TB. The part I'm more worried about is how well the gallery viewer will handle search requests.

The biggest advantage of ZeroGalleries over simple torrents is that they can be previewed, partially downloaded, liked and commented on.

> Millchan and Millchan Engine
They are both made by the same dev, but the Engine one has each board be it's own zite which means you only download the ones you want. Unfortunately they are not compatible so boards are often doubled.

Free and anonymous hosting.

@Ansho Rei: Ok good! The hub is no longer signing the gallery list when I press sign and publish all.
The tabs are a nice touch. It's more like the merger site now.

@Ansho Rei: The biggest hub of mine has 2.5 million files, so at least 3-4 million. And 20 million for Mangadex could be right when you realize a lot of their manga don't have any pages because they respect scanlator takedown requests and DMCA.

I tested zipping galleries and I don't like it. It helps with ZeroNet speed and cuts database size but sometimes the browser caches corrupted partial images and every time I fix an error like cropping cover image the whole zip has to be updated.

Thx for the updates though.
@Mg0: I'm only zipping the thumbnails, that's a 1-2MB total file. Hopefully a better solution for many files is developed for ZeroNet then normal and zip.
@Ansho Rei: Have you been able to work on the continous mode yet?
